      java.lang.String sk2did(kotlin.Array[] sk)
      generate DID by user secret Key. and use default Wallet type: ACCOUNT ED25519 SHA3
      java.lang.String sk2did(RoleType roleType, KeyType keyType, HashType hashType, kotlin.Array[] sk)
      generate DID by user secret Key. Step 1: Choose the RoleType, KeyType and Hash from above, let's use application, ed25519 and sha3 in this example. Step 2: Choose a secret key randomly, e.g. D67C071B6F51D2B61180B9B1AA9BE0DD0704619F0E30453AB4A592B036EDE644E4852B7091317E3622068E62A5127D1FB0D4AE2FC50213295E10652D2F0ABFC7 Step 3: Generate the public key of this secret key by using the KeyType. So we can get public key E4852B7091317E3622068E62A5127D1FB0D4AE2FC50213295E10652D2F0ABFC7 Step 4: Get the Hash of the public key EC8E681514753FE5955D3E8B57DAEC9D123E3DB146BDDFC3787163F77F057C27 Step 5: Take the first 20 bytes of the public key hash EC8E681514753FE5955D3E8B57DAEC9D123E3DB1 Step 6: Add the DID type bytes 0x0C01 in front of the hash of Step 4 0C01EC8E681514753FE5955D3E8B57DAEC9D123E3DB1 Step 7: Get the hash of the extended hash in Step 6 42CD815145538F8003586C880AF94418341F9C4B8FA0394876553F8A952C7D03 Step 8: Take the first 4 bytes in step 7 42CD8151 Step 9: Append the 4 bytes in step 8 to the extended hash in step 6. This is the binary DID string 0C01EC8E681514753FE5955D3E8B57DAEC9D123E3DB142CD8151 Step 10: Encode the binary value by using the Bitcoin Base58 method. zNKtCNqYWLYWYW3gWRA1vnRykfCBZYHZvzKr Step 11: Assemble the parts and get the full DID did:abt:zNKtCNqYWLYWYW3gWRA1vnRykfCBZYHZvzKr

public DidKeyPair genAppKeyPair(@NotNull
                                         java.lang.String appid,
                                         int index,
                                         @NotNull
                                         kotlin.Array[] seed,
                                         @NotNull
                                         KeyType keyType)

        generate HD key pair for one Application

        Parameters:
        appid - Application ID
        index - ID wallet index
        seed - user master seed
        keyType - ED25519 or SECP256K1
        Returns:
        HD key pair

      • sk2did

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String sk2did(@NotNull
                                        kotlin.Array[] sk)

        generate DID by user secret Key. and use default Wallet type: ACCOUNT ED25519 SHA3

      • sk2did

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String sk2did(@NotNull
                                        RoleType roleType,
                                        @NotNull
                                        KeyType keyType,
                                        @NotNull
                                        HashType hashType,
                                        @NotNull
                                        kotlin.Array[] sk)

        generate DID by user secret Key. Step 1: Choose the RoleType, KeyType and Hash from above, let's use application, ed25519 and sha3 in this example. Step 2: Choose a secret key randomly, e.g. D67C071B6F51D2B61180B9B1AA9BE0DD0704619F0E30453AB4A592B036EDE644E4852B7091317E3622068E62A5127D1FB0D4AE2FC50213295E10652D2F0ABFC7 Step 3: Generate the public key of this secret key by using the KeyType. So we can get public key E4852B7091317E3622068E62A5127D1FB0D4AE2FC50213295E10652D2F0ABFC7 Step 4: Get the Hash of the public key EC8E681514753FE5955D3E8B57DAEC9D123E3DB146BDDFC3787163F77F057C27 Step 5: Take the first 20 bytes of the public key hash EC8E681514753FE5955D3E8B57DAEC9D123E3DB1 Step 6: Add the DID type bytes 0x0C01 in front of the hash of Step 4 0C01EC8E681514753FE5955D3E8B57DAEC9D123E3DB1 Step 7: Get the hash of the extended hash in Step 6 42CD815145538F8003586C880AF94418341F9C4B8FA0394876553F8A952C7D03 Step 8: Take the first 4 bytes in step 7 42CD8151 Step 9: Append the 4 bytes in step 8 to the extended hash in step 6. This is the binary DID string 0C01EC8E681514753FE5955D3E8B57DAEC9D123E3DB142CD8151 Step 10: Encode the binary value by using the Bitcoin Base58 method. zNKtCNqYWLYWYW3gWRA1vnRykfCBZYHZvzKr Step 11: Assemble the parts and get the full DID did:abt:zNKtCNqYWLYWYW3gWRA1vnRykfCBZYHZvzKr

      • genAssetDid

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String genAssetDid(@NotNull
                                             java.lang.String senderAddress,
                                             @NotNull
                                             kotlin.Array[] itx)

        Generate Asset Address for CreateAssetTX

        Parameters:
        senderAddress - Assert Creator 's address ,like :z1cserc3KL1cL..
        itx - CreateAssetTx encode with Asset_address is empty
        Returns:
        Asset address

      • pk2did

        @NotNull
public java.lang.String pk2did(@NotNull
                                        RoleType roleType,
                                        @NotNull
                                        KeyType keyType,
                                        @NotNull
                                        HashType hashType,
                                        @NotNull
                                        kotlin.Array[] pk)

        Generate DID by user publicKey

        Parameters:
        roleType - use enum RoleType, such as ACCOUNT or APPLICATION
        keyType - publicKey type ED25519 or SECP256K1
        hashType - enum HashType, such as SHA3 or KECCAK
